cont.entity_a: Wireless connection speed is significantly faster compared to Linksys.
cont.entity_b: Wireless N devices do not connect.

cont.entity_a: 256-bit WEP is a liked feature. Good security features including 256-bit WEP and MAC filtering.
SSID cannot be turned off without connectivity issues. Router requires daily reboots to maintain internet connection.
cont.entity_b: Router crashes occasionally and requires reboots. Router does not recover quickly from connection drops. Connectivity issues are frequent.

cont.entity_a: Full signal strength throughout the house. Router is reliable with good range and speed throughout the house.
cont.entity_b: Router has less range than older models. Wireless range is limited compared to other models.

cont.entity_a: Advanced firewall configuration, including time-based port opening. Setup is straightforward, but network wizard is required for changes. Setup pages are cryptic, and DHCP lease time for WAN is unavailable. Firmware and drivers not optimized for 22 Mbps mode. VPN works well with the router. Router works well with multiple devices connected. Installation and configuration are easy, with good performance for average demands.
cont.entity_b: Supports DD-WRT software, adding many features. Setup wizard does not work with Windows XP. Runs solid with DD-WRT, stays up for weeks without rebooting. USB storage features are limited. Router works well as a gigabit switch with DD-WRT firmware.
Setup is easier with web-based interface than included utility.

cont.entity_a: Setup is easy with provided guides and firmware upgrades.
cont.entity_b: Easy setup with animated connection video. Easy setup and works well for simple internet connections.

cont.entity_a: Firmware upgrade needed for basic functionality. Performance issues with firmware causing periodic connection drops.
cont.entity_b: Firmware has issues with NAT and wireless connections dropping. Discontinued model with no firmware support. USB performance is slow, and firmware requires frequent reboots.

cont.entity_a: Problems connecting with AirPort card on Macintosh. Range issues with older models and interference from other devices.
Customer service has long wait times and limited solutions.

cont.entity_b: Router does not recover quickly from connection drops.
